newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: SAB shares rise, prospects seen good.
newsitem.headline: SAB shares rise, prospects seen good.

text.p: Shares in drinks giant South African Breweries Ltd rose on Monday as the market digested the prospects for its international expansion.
SAB rose 225 cents, or 1.88 percent, to 121.75 rand attracting 141 separate moves, the highest level in morning trade on the Johannesburg Stock Exchange.
More than 175,000 shares had changed hands by 1030 GMT.
"The company's cash flows are strong, prospects are good. There is nothing negative to say about the company really," said Wynand van Zyl, analyst at SMK Securities.

On Friday SAB said it had authorised an offering of around $360 million to fund its international expansion. The offering is one of the largest emerging market equity issues to international investors undertaken by a private sector company.
The offer could be raised to $410 million if there was sufficient demand via an over-allocation option. International demand for the share offering exceeded $600 million.
The firm has sown up its domestic market and is expanding abroad, in areas like China and central Europe, in order to maintain its strong recent growth levels.
"The (share) issue is going to be a success. It will give them the cash they need to keep going overseas," another analyst said.
Van Zyl said the shares had looked undervalued just after the announcement of the placing and predicted an upward trend over the next six months.
He said the stock could go as high 140 rand by next March.
